columns.text: In this problem, we will determine how much money is needed to be saved in order to become a millionaire given the different conditions and time constraints.

Simplifying the equation, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\$1,000,000&=\text{Payment}\times\dfrac{(1+0.008083)^{480}-1}{0.008083}\\[15 pt]
\$1,000,000&=\text{Payment}\times5,773.50
\end{aligned}$$

Divide both sides by $5,773.50$ to get the necessary payment. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Payment}&=\dfrac{\$1,000,000}{5,773.50}\\[15 pt]
&=\$173.21
\end{aligned}$$

This means that a payment/deposit of $\$173.21$ is needed to achieve a $9.7\%$ return on a million dollars by 40 years.

Next, we will solve for the required payment/deposit if the deposits will start ten years later. We will use the same concept as in Step 4 but the time will now be $30$ years which is equivalent to $\text{time}=360$. We will now get this equation:

Simplifying the equation, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\$1,000,000&=\text{Payment}\times\dfrac{(1+0.008083)^{360}-1}{0.008083}\\[15 pt]
\$1,000,000&=\text{Payment}\times 2,120.64
\end{aligned}$$

Divide both sides by $2,120.64$ to get the corresponding amount.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Payment}&=\dfrac{\$1,000,000}{2,120.64}\\[15 pt]
&=\$471.56
\end{aligned}$$

If the deposits will start $10$ years later, then the required deposit to reach the given rate of return is $\$471.56$

Finally, to solve for the required payment/deposit if it will start $20$ years later, we will again copy the formula in Step 4 but the time will now be $20$ years which is equivalent to $240$ months.

$$\begin{aligned}
\$1,000,000&=\text{Payment}\times\dfrac{(1+0.008083)^{240}-1}{0.008083}\\[15 pt]
\$1,000,000&=\text{Payment}\times 730.44
\end{aligned}$$

Divide both sides by $730.44$ to get the corresponding amount.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Payment}&=\dfrac{\$1,000,000}{730.44}\\[15 pt]
&=\$1,369.04
\end{aligned}$$

If the deposits will start $20$ years later, then the required deposit to reach the given rate of return is $\$1,369.04$
